channel.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
channel.description:
A short while ago, @FortyMiles asked [What apps / Daw have you used other than auxy to produce?](https://disco.auxy.co/t/what-apps-daw-have-you-used-other-than-auxy-to-produce/2220).
Made me wonder, who here also uses hardware – synths, drum machines, sequencers, effects, etc… besides Auxy? What kinda hardware gear do y'all have?
[Updated]
* [Korg Minilogue](http://www.korg.com/uk/products/synthesizers/minilogue/) * [Korg Volca Keys](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pz3GO6klEps) * [Volca Bass](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cr356H_1i_w) * [Volca FM](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4EVUu9FyQyc) * [Strymon El Capistan](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bcErOdt1C58) dTape echo/delay pedal * [TC Electronic Hall of Fame 2 reverb pedal](http://www.tcelectronic.com/hall-of-fame-2-reverb/) * [TC Electronic MojoMojo Overdrive pedal](http://www.tcelectronic.com/mojomojo-overdrive/) * [TC Electronic Corona Chorus pedal](http://www.tcelectronic.com/corona-chorus/) * [EHX SuperEgo+ drone/multi-modulation pedal](https://www.ehx.com/products/superego-plus) * [Arturia MiniLab 2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2g1T4GIKWIE) midi controller keyboard (for use with Ableton Live and iOS synths) * [Novation LaunchKey 49](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d29FFKwp0ks) midi controller keyboard (for use with Ableton Live and iOS synths) * [Focusrite Scarlett 6i6](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rcLnJEGac7o) audio interface * Bought and sold an [Ableton Push 2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0CdMvkBOUgs), which I never clicked with.
My current shopping/wish list:
* [Arp Odyssey module](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xxBqk8q5-vs)* * Possibly a hardware sequencer, possibly [BeatStep Pro](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CBh-OMlwF7A) – though may just stick with Ableton Live * Decent mono-synth, maybe to [Korg Monologue](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pMb12zqXKWE) or, more likely, [Moog Minitaur](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_NXrSPQ7aHY) * Splashing out on a [Moog Subsequent 37](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fS8syO7u0fY)* (_drool_) * Despite flipping the Push 2, I may pick up a [Maschine 3](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZZDSHlRksQQ), primarily for beats.
\* I'm actually torn on some purchases. For instance, I _want_ an [Arp Odyssey](http://www.arpsynth.com/en/) and I wouldn't mind a [Korg MS-20 Mini](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B5iNh7re44k), but I need to properly explore the software versions of popular analogue synths, before I splash out on the hardware. Besides, the app versions add presets and save slots, for reproducability.
I should certainly see how far I can get using Korg's ARP ODYSSEi app, Arturia's iMini (Mini Moog) app and Moog's own Model 15 app before splashing out on their respective hardware – _especially_ the Subsequent 37! ;)
Stuff like this doesn't help me make rational decisions… ;) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y3QgXLLX_Rs https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=evi12DFoPrc
Note: It was while finding reference links for the two Volcas for this post that I convinced myself that I _absolutely needed_ them – so bought them both.
Sudden onset of [GAS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gear_Acquisition_Syndrome). ;)

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Beats would be one use, but I was thinking more about vocal chops and one-hit sound effects, including toned samples.

I’ll check out some vids on YT.

Read full topic
item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: moemx
item.description:
Sure. In my experience the Mikro is really useful as an addition, I mainly use it to to play around before I get more serious with everything else. I guess if you’re not looking for a full force controller but rather for an addon to make eg beat making a little more fun and playful (and give it your personal touch) the Mikro is the way to go!

Read full topic
item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
moemx:

NI maschine Mikro

Didn’t know about that one. I should take a proper look.
A quick google suggests it might be the sort of thing I’m looking for.

(I had an Ableton Push 2, but sold it because I never used it.
Now that I’ve moved on a bit as a music maker, I was thinking of grabbing a Maschine Mk3 – or, ironically, a Push 2.
However, that Maschine Mikro seems like it might give me what I want without all the fuss (and presumably, significantly cheaper than either the Maschine Mk3 or the Push 2. Though, the Push 2 integrates really well with slicing in Live, and that’s gonna pay off. Hmmm)

Read full topic
item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Do you have tracks you’ve made using it? Curious to hear how you’ve used it in your actual tracks.

Read full topic
item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: moemx
item.description:
Nice topic.
I’ve got mostly instruments (since I didn’t do much electronic music before a few months ago): a normal guitar, a Yamaha silent guitar, Yamaha p155 Epiano, Roland vdrums and - for the electronic part - a NI maschine Mikro, which is a lot of fun to play around with.

Don’t wanna list every sound / midi box and cable now

Read full topic
item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
akabillposters:

I’m a little concerned about the limited memory and low bitrate, and how that limits sample length and quality.

It’s nice having the vintage feel, but when that’s the only option…

I guess it depends on your style of music.
For anything vintage house/techno or boom-bap, it sounds like magic.

It might be low bitrate, but it doesn’t sound low quality.

Read full topic
item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Hey, @blakkaz, could you point me to some of your tracks that use the Volca Sample?

I feel like I want to grab one, and would be good to hear how you’ve used it in your music.

I’m a little concerned about the limited memory and low bitrate, and how that limits sample length and quality.
It’s nice having the vintage feel, but when that’s the only option…

(I’m wondering how well it would work for mid/hi-quality vocal chops.)

Read full topic

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
:sigh: GAS

So, since my last post, I can add this to the pile in the corner…

TC Electronic MojoMojo Overdrive pedal
TC Electronic Corona Chorus pedal
EHX SuperEgo+ drone/multi-modulation pedal

Note: None of those were on my shopping list 11 days ago.
Still, at least I appear to have stopped buying hardware synths.

Read full topic

item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: ImOnlySleeping
item.description:
SP404 - great FXs and it’s really fun/fast for sound design
SP202 - really nice lofi sampling modes. You can get that nice lofi ringing sound
ESI-2000 - just an old sampler that I run drums through sometimes. Also lets you degrade the sample quality to get an older sound
Ableton Push
I love samplers obviously. It’s cool that some of you use Volcas and stuff like that. I’ve always wanted to try them

Read full topic
item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

Read full topic
item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Oh, well. Guess I can tick the Korg Minilogue off my shopping list – and am struggling to fight off the urge to tick off the Moog Minitaur too.
Running out of audio inputs and midi outputs.

I really need to watch fewer lush reverb and delay-laden analogue synth videos on the YouTubes.

Read full topic
item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
I think music machines are awesome and it’s why I got into this whole thing in the first place. Curious to hear more about which machines (or pieces of gear in general) that you think have really helped you to make more music and better tracks? I think there’s a difference between the excitement you get from e.g. a Moog synthesizer, simply because it’s a beautiful machine, and the pieces you end up being most creative with.

Read full topic
item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
i have a quality 2011 macbook air, a set of tdk headphones from like 4 years ago, and the highest quality DAW on the market: Garageband

item.source: What music hardware do you have/use?

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
akabillposters:

Might pick one up as a basic drum machine.

I had the Elektron Rytm on my shopping list, but haven’t felt the need for it since picking up the Sample.
It gives everything a lovely vintage colour, and is far deeper than it appears.

Highly recommended.

Read full topic

item.title: What music hardware do you have/use?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
A short while ago, @FortyMiles asked What apps / Daw have you used other than auxy to produce?.

Made me wonder, who here also uses hardware – synths, drum machines, sequencers, effects, etc… besides Auxy?
What kinda hardware gear do y’all have?

[Updated]

  • Korg Minilogue
  • Korg Volca Keys
  • Volca Bass
  • Volca FM
  • Strymon El Capistan dTape echo/delay pedal
  • TC Electronic Hall of Fame 2 reverb pedal
  • TC Electronic MojoMojo Overdrive pedal
  • TC Electronic Corona Chorus pedal
  • EHX SuperEgo+ drone/multi-modulation pedal
  • Arturia MiniLab 2 midi controller keyboard (for use with Ableton Live and iOS synths)
  • Novation LaunchKey 49 midi controller keyboard (for use with Ableton Live and iOS synths)
  • Focusrite Scarlett 6i6 audio interface
  • Bought and sold an Ableton Push 2, which I never clicked with.

My current shopping/wish list:

  • Arp Odyssey module*
  • Possibly a hardware sequencer, possibly BeatStep Pro – though may just stick with Ableton Live
  • Decent mono-synth, maybe to Korg Monologue or, more likely, Moog Minitaur
  • Splashing out on a Moog Subsequent 37* (drool)
  • Despite flipping the Push 2, I may pick up a Maschine 3, primarily for beats.

* I’m actually torn on some purchases. For instance, I want an Arp Odyssey and I wouldn’t mind a Korg MS-20 Mini, but I need to properly explore the software versions of popular analogue synths, before I splash out on the hardware.
Besides, the app versions add presets and save slots, for reproducability.

I should certainly see how far I can get using Korg’s ARP ODYSSEi app, Arturia’s iMini (Mini Moog) app and Moog’s own Model 15 app before splashing out on their respective hardware – especially the Subsequent 37!

Stuff like this doesn’t help me make rational decisions…

https://www.youtube.com/embed/y3QgXLLX_Rs


https://www.youtube.com/embed/evi12DFoPrc

Note: It was while finding reference links for the two Volcas for this post that I convinced myself that I absolutely needed them – so bought them both.

Sudden onset of GAS.

Read full topic
